channel.title: Environmental Variables
channel.description:
[URL=http://s05.flagcounter.com/more/zjDi][IMG]http://s05.flagcounter.com/count/zjDi/bg=FFFFFF/txt=000000/border=CCCCCC/columns=3/maxflags=18/viewers=0/labels=0/[/img][/URL] [b][size=12pt]Hey guys[/size][/b], a lot of you have troubles compiling in the sever help section, and it's not your compiler, it's your environmental variables. This bugs me, and a lot of other members that are helping. So I made a guide to show you all how to set your environmental variables. [b][size=12pt]Now before you start flaming me[/size][/b] and saying that "this stuff is usless", "something like this is already stickied", "this isn't helping", or whatever. Just keep it to yourself. Cuz someone's junk is another one's treasure. [b][size=12pt]So lets begin![/size][/b]
[u][b]Difficulty[/b][/u] - 1/10.
[u][b]Description[/b][/u] - How to set up your envvironmental variables.
[center][b][u][size=14pt]Chapter 1 - Opening the environmental Variables[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[b][u]Step 1[/u][/b] - You are going to have to click start on the botton of your screen and then right click Computer. After you have done that, select properties:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step1.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 2[/u][/b] - This should bring you up to your computer propterties. Now what I want you to do is slect Advanced or Advanced System Settings tab in these computer propteries:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step2.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 3[/u][/b] - Now your at another box after you clicked the advaned tab. Now you have to select Environmental Variables:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step3.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Good job! Chapter 1 is completed. Now before we move on to chapter 2, you must have the following: - computer properties - advanced system settings/advanced tab opened - environmental variables box opened. Now for those of you who aren't eliminated from the requirements, move on to chapter 2. If not, try again!
[center][b][u][size=14pt]Chapter 2 - Setting up Path and Classpath[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[b][u]Step 1[/u][/b] - Alright, now you have opened your Environmental Variables tab, now click the new button:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step4.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 2[/u][/b] - This should bring you up to another box. Now in that box, Put the following:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step5.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Now replace that 20 in between the value into your java version. For example if your java version is 17, replace the 20 with 17. And also, the program files stuff is just the loaction of my java folder. Most likely yours to. If not, then pm me the loaction of your java folder and I'll tell you your classpath value.
[b][u]Step 3[/u][/b] - Now your Variable should end like this:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step6.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Now Press ok.
[b][u]Step 4[/u][/b] - Press new again:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step7.jpg[/img] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 5[/u][/b] - Now you gotta name your Variable Path. and next, just follow the picture:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step8.jpg[/img] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Same thing with Classpath, replace the 20 with the hava version you have. And same thing again, the program files stuff is the loaction of my java folder. message me to find out your loaction.
[b][u]Step 6[/u][/b] - Press ok again
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step9.jpg[/img] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Now you have set your Path and Classpath Variables. Time for Chapter 3! If you wanna move on, you must have the following: - two variables name classpath and path - two different values for two different variables
If you got those requirements, then it's time to move on!
[center][b][u][size=14pt]Chapter 3 - Finished[/size][/u][/b][/center]
[b][u]Step 1[/u][/b] - This is pretty much the easiest chapter. Press ok for the environmental variables box:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step10.jpg[/img] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 2[/u][/b] - Press ok for System properties:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step11.jpg[/img] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b][u]Step 3[/u][/b] - and finally, Close Computer properties:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [IMG]http://i868.photobucket.com/albums/ab246/triplehhhhhh/environmental%20variables/step12-1.jpg[/img] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You have Environmental Variables now!
This is 100% made by me. And no, I'm not trying to get rep, I'm not trying to be famous, and all these pictures above are 100% mine. If you got a problem with this, then don't post on this thread. Questions will be answered in private messages, not in this thread.

item.title: Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @_Kate1 ,Kate
item.description:
@_Kate1 wrote:

Thank you for the CLASSPATH and Path variables, had forgotten what they were.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental Variables
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:


[size=12pt]Hey guys[/size], a lot of you have troubles compiling in the sever help section, and it’s not your compiler, it’s your environmental variables. This bugs me, and a lot of other members that are helping. So I made a guide to show you all how to set your environmental variables.
[size=12pt]Now before you start flaming me[/size] and saying that “this stuff is usless”, “something like this is already stickied”, “this isn’t helping”, or whatever. Just keep it to yourself. Cuz someone’s junk is another one’s treasure.
[size=12pt]So lets begin![/size]

Difficulty - 1/10.

Description - How to set up your envvironmental variables.

[center][size=14pt]Chapter 1 - Opening the environmental Variables[/size][/center]

Step 1 - You are going to have to click start on the botton of your screen and then right click Computer. After you have done that, select properties:

step1.jpg556×541

Step 2 - This should bring you up to your computer propterties. Now what I want you to do is slect Advanced or Advanced System Settings tab in these computer propteries:

step2.jpg794×574

Step 3 - Now your at another box after you clicked the advaned tab. Now you have to select Environmental Variables:

Good job! Chapter 1 is completed. Now before we move on to chapter 2, you must have the following:

  • computer properties

  • advanced system settings/advanced tab opened

  • environmental variables box opened. Now for those of you who aren’t eliminated from the requirements, move on to chapter 2. If not, try again!

                                [center][b][u][size=14pt]Chapter 2 - Setting up Path and Classpath[/size][/u][/b][/center]

Step 1 - Alright, now you have opened your Environmental Variables tab, now click the new button:

Step 2 - This should bring you up to another box. Now in that box, Put the following:

Now replace that 20 in between the value into your java version. For example if your java version is 17, replace the 20 with 17.
And also, the program files stuff is just the loaction of my java folder. Most likely yours to. If not, then pm me the loaction of your java folder and I’ll tell you your classpath value.

Step 3 - Now your Variable should end like this:

Now Press ok.

Step 4 - Press new again:

Step 5 - Now you gotta name your Variable Path. and next, just follow the picture:

Same thing with Classpath, replace the 20 with the hava version you have. And same thing again, the program files stuff is the loaction of my java folder. message me to find out your loaction.

Step 6 - Press ok again

Now you have set your Path and Classpath Variables.
Time for Chapter 3! If you wanna move on, you must have the following:

  • two variables name classpath and path
  • two different values for two different variables

If you got those requirements, then it’s time to move on!

[center][size=14pt]Chapter 3 - Finished[/size][/center]

Step 1 - This is pretty much the easiest chapter. Press ok for the environmental variables box:

Step 2 - Press ok for System properties:

Step 3 - and finally, Close Computer properties:

step12-1.jpg798×600

You have Environmental Variables now!

This is 100% made by me.
And no, I’m not trying to get rep, I’m not trying to be famous, and all these pictures above are 100% mine.
If you got a problem with this, then don’t post on this thread.
Questions will be answered in private messages, not in this thread.

Read full topic
